body:
Hey @Eomm, thanks for clarifying the {error} return pattern - that makes sense.

I reproduced this and can confirm the different behavior between sync/async preValidation hooks. Would you be open to a PR to help with this? I was thinking:

Documentation - add some warnings/examples about returning {error} vs throwing, especially with async hooks
Tests - cover this scenario so it doesn't regress
Bug fix - make the error handling consistent between sync/async hooks
The thrown errors causing unhandled rejections is pretty nasty since it crashes the whole app instead of hitting the error handler.

Which would be most useful? Happy to tackle whichever makes the most sense.

Thanks for willing to help!

I can see 3 PRs:

1. Documentation: it is not well explained that we should return the error. it is mentions here and there: https://fastify.dev/docs/latest/Reference/Validation-and-Serialization but the only clear example refers to `yum` ü§¶üèº 
2. Bug fix + Test - make the error handling consistent between sync/async hooks
3. Handle the error: this one needs a bit of discussion/analysis because it could have some perf drawback, but at first read, it seems reasonable to handle it and return a 500 error

issue.body:
When a custom validator throws inside the normal validation step _after_ an async preValidation hook, the error was bubbling out as an unhandled rejection instead of being forwarded to Fastify‚Äôs error handling.

This change wraps the internal `validateSchema()` invocation in a try/catch so any synchronous error is routed through `reply.send(err)` and handled by the configured `setErrorHandler`.

A regression test (`test/async-prevalidation-validation-error.test.js`) reproduces the scenario and asserts that a 400 response is returned via the custom error handler.

Closes #6214

issue.title: fix: consistent error handling for custom validators in async validation contexts

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: Issue or PR that should land as semver patch

repository.name: fastify
repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.body:
## Description

Fixes inconsistent error handling between sync and async validation contexts when custom validators throw errors instead of returning `{error}` objects.

## Problem

When using async preValidation hooks with custom validators, if the validator throws an error (instead of returning `{error}`), the error would not be caught by the error handler and would result in an unhandled promise rejection, potentially crashing the application.

This inconsistency meant:
- **Sync context**: Thrown errors were caught and handled properly by the error handler
- **Async context**: Thrown errors became unhandled promise rejections

## Solution

Modified the `validateParam` function in `lib/validation.js` to wrap the `validatorFunction` call in a try-catch block. This ensures that synchronous throws are caught and returned as validation errors, making error handling consistent across both sync and async validation contexts.

## Changes

- **lib/validation.js**: Added try-catch block around `validatorFunction` call in `validateParam`
- **test/validation-error-handling.test.js**: Added test case to verify error handling consistency

## Testing

- ‚úÖ All existing tests pass
- ‚úÖ New test specifically validates the fix for async preValidation + custom validator error scenarios
- ‚úÖ Covers the exact issue described in #6214

## Breaking Changes

None. This change maintains backward compatibility while fixing the error handling inconsistency.

Fixes #6214
